gurmukhi: mwr hI mwr Alwp aucwrq duMdB Fol miRdMg Apwrw ]S`qRn ky isr A`qR qrwk lgY iqih qwln ko Tnkwrw ]
transliteration: Maar Himaar Alaap Ouchaarat Doundabh Dhol Mridan Apaaraa|| Shattran Ke Sir Attra Taraak Lagad Tih(i) Taalan Ko Thankaaraa||
translation: The shouts of “kill, kill” and the sound of drums and trumpets are being heard; with the blows of arms on the heads of the enemies, there is jingling of tunes;

gurmukhi: jUiJ igry Dir rIJ kY dyq hY pRwnn dwn vfy irJvwrw ]inrq krY nt kop lrY Bt ju`D kI Taur kI inrq AKwrw ]1388]
transliteration: Joojh(i) Gire Dhar(i) Reejh Kai Det Hai Praanan Daan Vade Rijhvaaraa|| Nirat Darai Nat Kop Darai Bhat Juddh Kithaur Kinirat Akhaaraa||
translation: The warriors while fighting and falling down appear like offering their life-force with pleasure; the warriors are jumping up in anger and it cannot be said, whether it is the battlefield or the arena of dancing.1388.

gurmukhi: rn BUim BeI rMg BUim mno Duin duMdB bwjy miRdMg hIXo ]isr S`qRn ky pr A`qR lgY qqkwr qrwkn qwl lIXo ]
transliteration: Ran Bhoom(i) Bhairan Bhoom(i) Mano Dhoun(i) Doundabh Baaje Mridan Heeyo|| Sir Shattran Ke Par Attra Lagad Tatkaar Taraakan Taal Leeyo||
translation: The battlefield has become like an arena of dancing, where there is play of musical instruments and drums; the heads of the enemies are producing a special sound and tune with the blows of arms;

gurmukhi: As lwgq JUm igrY mir kY Bt pRwnn mwnhu dwn dIXo ]br inrq krY ik lrY nt jXoN niRp mwr hI mwr su rwg kIXo ]1389]
transliteration: As Laagad Jhoom Girai Mar(i) Kai Bhat Praanan Maanoh Daan Deeyo|| Bar Nirat Darai Ki Darai Nat Jyon Maar Himaar Su Raag Keeyo||1389||
translation: The warriors falling on the earth seem to be making offerings of their life-breaths; they are dancing and singing like the actors, the melody of “kill, kill”/1389.

gurmukhi: ieqo ju`Du hir hyir kY sBhin khXo sunwie ]ko Bt lwiek sYn mY lrY ju Xw sMg jwie ]1390]
transliteration: Ito Juddh(u) Har(i) Her(i) Kai Sabh-han(i) Kahyo Sounaae|| Ko Bhat Laaik Sain Mai Darai Ju Yaa San Jaae||1390||
translation: Seeing such a battle, Krishna uttered loudly, his words being heard by all, “Who is that worthy warrior, who is going to fight with Kharag Singh?”1390.

gurmukhi: Gn isMG Gwq doaU joDy ]jwq n iksI suBt qy soDo ]Gn sur isMG GmMf isMG Dwey ]mwnhu cwro kwl pTwey ]1391]
transliteration: Ghan Singh Ghaat Dooo Jodhe|| Jaat Na Kisisoubhat Te Sodhe|| Ghan Sur Singh Ghamannd Singh Dhaae|| Maanoh Chdaro Kaal Pathaae||1391||
translation: GHAN Singh and Ghaat Singh were such warriors, whom no one could defeat; Ghansur Singh and Ghamand Singh also moved and it seemed that death had itself called all the four.1391.

gurmukhi: qb iqn qk chUMAn sr mwry ]cwro pRwn ibnw kir fwry ]sXMdn AsÍ sUq sB Gwey ]sYn sihq jm lok pTwey ]1392]
transliteration: Tah Tin Tak Chahoonan Sar Mdare|| Chdaro Praan Binaa Kar(i) Ddare|| Syandan Asv Soot Sabh Ghaae|| Sain Sahit Jam Lok Pathaae||1392||
translation: Then seeing towards them, the arrows were discharged on all the four and they were made lifeless; the horses and charioteers of their chariots were all wounded and alongwith the army, they were all sent to the abode of Yama.1392.

gurmukhi: cpl isMG Aru cqur isMG cMcl sRI blvwn ]icqR isMG Aru caup isMG mhwrQI sur gXwn ]1393]
transliteration: Chapal Singh Ar(u( Chatur Singh Channdhal Sribalvaan|| Chitra Singh Ar(u) Chaoup Singh Mahaarathisur Gyaan||1393||
translation: The great warriors like Chapal Singh, Chatur Singh, Chitar Singh, Chaup Singh etc., were present there.1393.

gurmukhi: CqR isMG Ar mwn isMG S`qR isMG blbMf ]isMG cmUM piq Aiq blI Buj bil qwih AKMf ]1394]
transliteration: Chhatra Singh Ar Maan Mingh Shattra Singh Balband|| Singh Chamoond Pat(i) At(i) Bali Bhuj Bal(i) Taah(i) Akhannd||1394||
translation: Chhattar Singh, Man Singh, Shatar Singh etc., wre the mighty generals who were present there.1394.
